fields.html:
In exchange for listing my products on Stunable.com, I agree to read and comply with the following terms of use.

I certify that I have both the legal capacity and authorization, if acting as an agent, to enter into this agreement on behalf of the entity whose products will be listed on Stunable.com.

Stunable has developed a proprietary search engine that allows end users to uniquely seek and find Products in the Stunable application and all subsequent forms of Stunable proprietary media. Retailer desires to provide Stunable with a catalog of Products for the database which will be searchable by the Stunable application. Retailer agrees to work together to create a process whereby Stunable will intake orders for Retailer’s Products and notify Retailer of the order. Stunable will process payment transactions for orders but fulfillment of such transactions, including shipping, handling, and returns will be conducted by Retailer.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and conditions contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, and intending to be legally bound, the Parties agree as follows:

  1. AGREEMENT FOR SERVICES
    1. Stunable agrees to provide Retailer with the ability to place a full range of Products in a searchable database on the Stunable application, including Stunable’s website, Stunable.com, and all subsequent forms of media developed by Stunable.
      1. As part of the Stunable application features, Stunable will be an intake point of orders for Retailer’s Products.  Stunable will generate a notification of the order on Retailer’s Stunable Retailer Account platform as well as via email.
    2. Retailer agrees to place a full range of Products on the Stunable web site.
      1. Retailer agrees to provide Stunable with Products to be searched on the Stunable application which are currently being sold by Retailer.
        1. Stunable will endeavor to display Products to end users that are currently available through Retailer but may also display Products that are currently unavailable or “sold out” for the purpose of allowing Stunable’s users to bookmark and share these Products. Stunable will prohibit Retailer’s unavailable Products from being purchased on the Stunable application.
        2. Retailer agrees to maintain and update Product inventory in a timely manner and to refrain from making available for purchase on Retailer’s web site, Products, which Retailer does not have the immediate capacity to deliver through reasonable shipping and handling methods to online shoppers.
    3. Retailer acknowledges that Stunable cannot control whether an end user will be interested in the Products presented by Retailer.
    4. Retailer agrees to create a Merchant Account through the third party payment service, Paypal (paypal.com) and abide by all provisions and terms of service as designated by Paypal.
      1. Failure of Retailer to adhere to Paypal’s terms of service resulting in delay or failure of Retailer to fulfill any of the obligations contained herein and relating to Retailer’s participation in the Stunable application shall be considered a breach of the Agreement.
    5. Retailer will cooperate with Stunable and will promptly provide Stunable with all pertinent materials and requested information in order for Stunable to perform its Services pursuant to this Agreement.
    6. Stunable will accept and process payments for any Products purchased on the Stunable website.
    7. Retailer  agrees to process any and all returns of Products purchased on the Stunable application in accordance with Stunable policy.
    8. Retailer agrees to adhere to the policies and provisions of Stunable’s Standard Return Policy providing for the return of non-damaged, unworn Products within twenty-one [21] days of Product’s purchase. If Retailer does not wish to comply with Stunable’s Standard Return Policy, Retailer may endeavor to sell Retailer’s Products on the Stunable application pursuant the Agreement so long so as Retailer accepts and agrees to adhere to Stunable’s No Return Policy.
      1. Retailer acknowledges and agrees to be bound by Stunable’s return policy with which, timely compliance is necessary to the Retailer’s fulfillment of the obligations contained herein. Retailer accepts liability for and agrees that any delay or failure by Retailer to comply with Stunable’s return policy shall be considered a breach of the Agreement.
      2. Retailer agrees to release Stunable from liability for any disputes or claims arising out of or in connection with the return of Retailer’s Products. Retailer further agrees to release Stunable from any claim or obligation to reimburse Retailer for amounts paid to Stunable (“Commission”) in exchange for the sale and processing of orders containing Products sold on Stunable, which are ultimately returned to the Retailer.
  2. PAYMENT AND ORDER FULFILLMENT SERVICES
    1. Retailer agrees to pay to Stunable a fee based on the formula set forth below (“Commission”) when an end user places an order for its Product through the Stunable application.
    2. Stunable’s Commission shall be based upon the consideration received by Retailer for sales generated from the Stunable application. Commission is calculated by determining a percentage of the listed price of Products sold on the Stunable application. Commission paid to Stunable will NOT be based on the final price of an entire order, which will include additional charges for shipping, handling and applicable taxes. Commission will be determined under the below formula (in US dollars) during the Term of this Agreement:

      3. 20% of all US dollars

    3. Stunable will notify Retailer of orders placed on the Stunable application containing Retailer’s Products via Order Notifications generated on Retailer’s Stunable Retailer Account as well as notifications sent directly to Retailer’s email address. The Initial Order Notifications will be generated immediately after an order is placed on the Stunable application.
    4. Retailer accepts responsibility for and agrees to monitor Retailer’s Shopwtihstella Retailer Account and the email account provided to Stunable by Retailer for Order Notifications on a daily basis.
      1. Retailer agrees to maintain and update all contact and reasonably related business information immediately upon the occurrence of changes or alterations made to the information.
      2. Under no circumstances shall Retailer make changes to Retailer’s contact information as provided to Stunable by Retailer without first providing Stunable with written notice, such that timely communication between Retailer and Stunable is impeded.
      3. In the event Stunable is prevented from engaging in timely communication with Retailer due to delay or failure on behalf of Retailer to provide Stunable with immediate and accurate notice of all relevant changes to Retailer’s contact and reasonably related business information, Retailer accepts liability for and agrees to be considered in breach of the Agreement.
    5. Retailer accepts responsibility for and agrees to fulfill orders generated on the Stunable application immediately upon receipt of the Initial Order Notifications. At the very latest, Retailer agrees and accepts responsibility for shipping Products ordered through the Stunable application within no more than seven [7] days or one hundred and sixty-eight [168] hours upon receipt of the Initial Order Notifications.
    6. Retailer will verify that Products have been shipped according to the details contained within the Order Notifications by entering a valid tracking label into Retailer’s Stunable Retailer Account platform. The Stunable application will authenticate the tracking number using third party shipping software, at which point orders will be marked as “shipped.”
    7. Only upon timely fulfillment of the order process as outlined in the preceding section [II-E] shall Stunable release payment for Products less the commission paid to Stunable by Retailer as described in the preceding section [II-B] to Retailer’s Paypal Merchant Account.
    8. In the event of delay or failure of Retailer to fulfill orders according to the process outlined in section [II-E], Retailer shall be considered in breach of the Agreement. Stunable reserves the right, to which Retailer agrees to be bound, to suspend Retailer’s participation in the Stunable application and issue any other sanctions deemed by Stunable to be reasonably necessary to ensure Retailer’s future engagements with Stunable are both timely and in accordance with Stunable policy.
    9. If a bona fide dispute, not including any delay or failure of Retailer to comply with the terms and conditions contained herein, arises with respect to any invoice, Retailer shall not be deemed in default under the Agreement and the Parties shall not suspend the performance of their respective obligations hereunder, including payment of undisputed amounts owed hereunder.
    10. If amounts become due to Stunable due to delay or failure of Retailer to fulfill orders according to the process outlined in section [II-E], misrepresentation, fraud, breach of the agreement on behalf of Retailer, or illegality, all payments that are not paid when due shall bear interest accruing from the date becoming past due until paid in full at a rate equal to the greater of 1.5% per month or the maximum rate allowed by applicable law.  All payments made hereunder shall be non-refundable, be made free and clear of any tax, levy, assessment, duties or other charges and not subject to reduction, withholding, set-off, or adjustment of any kind.   
    11. The Parties agree that disputes arising out of or in connection with Commissions payment will be reduced with the use of third party tracking software placed on the Stunable application and available to both Parties, which is responsible for recording order details. Disputes should also be reduced with timely communication between Retailer and Stunable representatives as to the nature of the dispute.
    12. In the event of non-payment by Retailer, Stunable shall be entitled to immediately and without notice to Retailer terminate the Services being provided hereunder.  In addition, Stunable will be entitled to pursue all other available remedies under law and equity against Retailer to obtain all payments due hereunder.  Retailer shall be responsible for all costs incurred by Stunable for such collection including without limitation, for legal fees incurred.
  3. TERM
    1. The term of the Agreement shall be three (3) years unless terminated by either party on 30 days prior written notice.  This Agreement shall be renewed automatically for additional one (1) year term until otherwise terminated by either party on 30 days prior written notice.
  4. CONFIDENTIALITY
    1. Retailer will provide Stunable with access to Retailer’s Product databases.
      1. Stunable will not request nor be granted access to any of Retailer’s user account information or other end user personal information that is not required for Stunable to perform its obligations hereunder.
    2. For purposes of this Agreement, Confidential Information shall have the meanings below.
      1. Confidential Information means any information or data disclosed by a Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party") which (1) if in tangible form or other media that can be converted to readable form is clearly marked as proprietary, confidential or private when disclosed, or (2) if oral or visual, is identified as proprietary, confidential, or private when disclosed or is reasonably understood by the Parties to be proprietary, confidential, or private when disclosed.  Confidential Information includes any and all proprietary information, whether of a technical, business or other nature including without limitation, processes, algorithms, apparatus, equipment, formulae, data, software, technology, know-how, designs, inventions, experimental work, development, details and specifications, and/or trade and business secrets, sales, and financial information.
      2. Confidential Information includes any and all statistics gathered by the Tracking Software relating to the Products of Retailer including any indentifying information of end users, end user behavior, sales information, click-through behavior and other information which is reasonably understood by the Parties to be proprietary.
      3. Confidential Information shall not, however, include any information which: (i) was publicly known and made generally available in the public domain prior to the time of disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (ii) becomes publicly known and made generally available after disclosure by the Disclosing Party through no action or inaction of the Receiving Party; (iii) is already in the possession of the Receiving Party at the time of disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (iv) is obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without a breach of such third party's obligations of confidentiality; (v) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (vi) is required by law to be disclosed by the Receiving Party, provided that the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party prompt written notice of such requirement prior to such disclosure and reasonable assistance in obtaining an order protecting the information from public disclosure.
      4. Both Parties agree not to divulge Confidential Information, to any third Party, unless the other Party agrees otherwise in writing. Additionally, neither Party shall use any Confidential Information of the other Party for any purpose other than for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement.
      5. Each Party represents and warrants that it has established appropriate internal procedures for protecting the other Party’s Confidential Information.
      6. Each Party agrees that the disclosing Party would be irreparably injured by a breach of this Section by the receiving Party and that the disclosing Party may be entitled to equitable relief, including injunctive relief and specific performance, in the event of any breach of the provisions of this Section.  Such remedies shall not be deemed to be the exclusive remedies for a breach of this Section, but shall be in addition to all other remedies available at law or in equity.
      7. The obligations hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
  5. NOTICES
    1. The Parties agree that it is acceptable to address all notices and communications concerning Services described in this Agreement to email addresses.
  6. COPYRIGHT, TRADEMARK & PERMISSION TO PROMOTE & REFERENCE RETAILER & PRODUCTS
    1. Stunable desires to include materials, some of which may be subject to Retailer’s copyright and trademark ownership, to both identify the source of Products and provide exposure as well as background information concerning Retailer’s entity and Products. For example, a Stunable user may wish to learn more about a particular Retailer and do so by clicking on Retailer’s logo or image contained within the Stunable application, which may re-direct the user to a short description of Retailer’s Products and entity. As a condition for inclusion in the Stunable application, Retailer acknowledges and agrees to release Stunable from any and all federal, state and common law claims arising out of or in connection with display, distribution and reproduction of Retailer’s material subject to copyright and trademark ownership by Retailer, including representations of text, pictures, logos, phrases, names, and computer code that may be used in connection with Retailer’s Products on the Stunable application or in any promotional and media materials issued by Stunable.
    2. Retailer agrees and grants permission to Stunable to display, distribute and reproduce material subject to copyright and trademark protection on the Stunable application and within any media and promotional material issued by Stunable in consideration for the enumerated services relating to the promotion, marketing and sale of Retailer’s Products.
    3. If Retailer desires to exclude copyright or trademark materials from Stunable’s promotional publications, for example, press releases or social media posts, Retailer may do so by contacting the appropriate Stunable representative.
    4. If Retailer wishes to use materials subject to Stunable’s copyright or trademark ownership, Retailer may do so with permission from the appropriate Stunable representative.  
    5. Retailer agrees that Stunable is not an information content provider within the meaning of the Communications Deceny Act. Retailer acknowledges that Stunable cannot determine how Retailer’s Products, company, brand, image and reputation will be perceived by the public in connection with Retailer’s participation in the Stunable application.
    6. Retailer grants to Stunable the authority to issue written and oral statements, make representations, and reproduce, display and distribute materials concerning Retailer and Products.
    7. Retailer agrees to release Stunable from liability arising out of or in connection with any statements or material Retailer may consider defamatory. Retailer further agrees to release Stunable from liability for any and all claims of defamation, libel, misrepresentation, and slander in so far as they relate to representations and statements made by or on behalf of Stunable and related third parties.
  7. REPRESENTATIONS & WARRANTIES.
    1. Retailer represents and warrants as of the date of this Agreement that:
      1. Retailer is duly organized and validly existing and in good standing in the jurisdiction of its organization;
      2. Retailer has the full right and authority to enter into, execute, deliver, and perform its obligations under the Agreement;
      3. Retailer has taken all requisite corporate or other action to approve the execution, delivery, and performance of the Agreement;
      4. the Agreement constitutes its legal, valid and binding obligation enforceable against such Party in accordance with its terms, except as may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, and other similar laws now or hereafter in effect relating to creditors’ rights generally;
      5. there is no litigation, action, proceeding or investigation pending or, to the best of Retailer’s knowledge, threatened before any court or other Governmental Authority by, against, affecting or involving any of Retailer’s business or assets that could reasonably be expected to adversely affect its ability to carry out the transactions contemplated herein; and
      6. Retailer’s execution and performance of the Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby do not constitute a breach of any term or provision of, or a default under any contract or agreement to which it or any of its affiliates is a party.
  8. EXCLUSION OF WARRANTIES
    9. STUNABLE MAKES NO WARRANTIES TO RETAILER OR ANY OTHER PERSON, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, AS TO THE DESIGN, DESCRIPTION, QUALITY, MERCHANTABILITY, COMPLETENESS, USEFULNESS, ECONOMIC VIABILITY, OR FITNESS FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE OF THE Stunable APPLICATION, ITS OBLIGATIONS BEING PROVIDED HEREUNDER OR DESCRIBED HEREIN, OR AS TO ANY OTHER MATTER, ALL OF WHICH ARE EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED BY Stunable.

  9. TAXES AND GOVERNMENTAL FEES
    1. Retailer shall timely report, make filings for, and pay any and all sales, use, income, gross receipts or other taxes, or similar fees assessed against it due to the sale of Products on the Stunable application.  The obligations hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
  10. FORCE MAJEURE
    1. “Force Majeure Event” means any act or event that prevents the Retailer from performing its obligations in accordance with the Agreement, if such act or event is beyond the reasonable control, and not the result of the fault or negligence, of the Retailer and the Retailer had been unable to overcome such act or event with the exercise of due diligence (including the expenditure of reasonable sums).  Subject to the foregoing conditions, “Force Majeure Event” shall include without limitation the following acts or events:  (i) natural phenomena, such as storms, hurricanes, floods, lightning, volcanic eruptions and earthquakes; (ii) explosions or fires arising from lightning or other causes unrelated to the acts or omissions of the Party seeking to be excused from performance; (iii) acts of war or public disorders, civil disturbances, riots, insurrection, sabotage, epidemic, terrorist acts, or rebellion; (iv) strikes or labor disputes; and (v) action or inaction by a governmental authority.  A Force Majeure Event shall not be based on the economic hardship of Retailer.
    2. Retailer shall be considered in breach of the Agreement or liable for any delay or failure to comply with the Agreement (other than the failure to pay amounts due hereunder), if and to the extent that such delay or failure is attributable to the occurrence of a Force Majeure Event; provided that the Retailer claiming relief under this Section shall immediately (i) notify Stunable in writing of the existence of the Force Majeure Event, (ii) exercise all reasonable efforts necessary to minimize delay caused by such Force Majeure Event, (iii) notify Stunable in writing of the cessation or termination of said Force Majeure Event and (iv) resume performance of its obligations hereunder as soon as practicable thereafter; provided, however, that Retailer shall not be excused from making any payments and paying any unpaid amounts due to Stunable.
  11. DEFAULT
    1. The following events shall be defaults:
      1. Retailer has (A) applied for or consented to the appointment of, or the taking of possession by, a receiver, custodian, trustee or liquidator of itself or of all or a substantial part of its property; (B) admitted in writing its inability, or be generally unable, to pay its debts as such debts become due; (C) made a general assignment for the benefit of its creditors; (D) commenced a voluntary case under any bankruptcy law; (E) filed a petition seeking to take advantage of any other law relating to bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, winding up, or composition or readjustment of debts; (F) failed to controvert in a timely and appropriate manner, or acquiesced in writing to, any petition filed against Retailer in an involuntary case under any bankruptcy law; or (G) taken any corporate or other action for the purpose of effecting any of the foregoing; or a proceeding or case has been commenced without the application or consent of Retailer in any court of competent jurisdiction seeking (A) its liquidation, reorganization, dissolution or winding-up or the composition or readjustment of debts or, (B) the appointment of a trustee, receiver, custodian, liquidator or the like of Retailer under any bankruptcy law, and such proceeding or case has continued undefended, or any order, judgment or decree approving or ordering any of the foregoing shall be entered and continue unstayed and in effect for a period of sixty (60) days.
      2. Retailer fails to pay Stunable any undisputed amount owed under the Agreement within thirty (30) days from receipt of invoice; and
      3. Retailer fails to ship Products ordered on the Stunable application within seven [7] days or one hundred and sixty-eight [168] hours of receipt of Initial Order Notifications in accordance with the order fulfillment obligations described in section [II-E].
      4. Retailer fails to use Retailer’s best efforts to immediately communicate to Stunable relevant changes to Retailer’s contact and reasonably related business information.
      5. Retailer fails to adhere to Paypal’s terms and conditions of use resulting in the delay or inability of Retailer to fulfill the obligations contained herein.
      6. Retailer breaches any material term of the Agreement and (A) if such breach can be cured within thirty (30) days after written notice of such breach and Retailer fails to so cure, or (B) Retailer fails to commence and pursue a cure within such thirty (30) day period if a longer cure period is needed.
    2. If a default under this Agreement occurs, Stunable, in addition to other remedies expressly provided herein, terminate the Agreement and exercise any other remedy it may have at law or equity or under the Agreement.
  12. LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY
    1. Except as expressly provided herein, neither Party shall be liable to the other Party for any special, punitive, exemplary, indirect, or consequential damages, losses or damages for lost revenue or lost profits, whether foreseeable or not, arising out of, or in connection with the Agreement.  The obligations hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
  13. ASSIGNMENT
    1. Neither Party shall sell, transfer or assign (collectively, an “Assignment”) the Agreement or any interest therein, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed; provided, however, that, without the prior consent, either Party may (i) assign this Agreement to an affiliate of said Party; (ii) assign this Agreement as collateral security in connection with any financing of either Party; or (iii) assign this Agreement to any entity that purchases all or substantially all of the Party’s assets or equity.
  14. INDEMNITY.
    1. Retailer agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless Stunable against any and all claims, losses, penalties, causes of action, damages, liability, costs, expenses (including but not limited to reasonable attorneys’ fees) or claims caused by or resulting indirectly from Retailer’s use of the Stunable service, without limitation or exception, including Retailer’s violation of any third-party’s rights, (including, without limitation, infringement of any copyright trademark, service mark, trade secrets, right of privacy or publicity or any other third party right).  The obligations hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
  15. MISCELLANEOUS.
    1. The Agreement constitutes the entire agreement and understanding between the Parties with respect to the subject matter thereof and supersedes all prior agreements relating to the subject matter hereof, which are of no further force or effect.
    2. This Agreement may only be amended, modified or supplemented by an instrument in writing executed by duly authorized representatives of each Party.
    3. Except as set forth to the contrary herein, any right or remedy of either Party shall be cumulative and without prejudice to any other right or remedy, whether contained herein or not.
    4. The failure of a Party to enforce any of the provisions of the Agreement, or the waiver thereof, shall not be construed as a general waiver or relinquishment on its part of any such provision, in any other instance or of any other provision in any instance.
    5. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the domestic laws of the State of New York without reference to any choice of law principles.  The Parties agree that the courts of New York and the Federal Courts sitting therein shall have jurisdiction over any action or proceeding arising under the Agreement.  The Parties waive any objection it may have to the laying of venue of any action or proceeding under this Agreement in any courts described in this Section.
    6. If any term, covenant or condition in the Agreement shall, to any extent, be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of the Agreement shall not be affected thereby, and each term, covenant or condition of the Agreement shall be valid and enforceable and, if appropriate, such invalid or unenforceable provision shall be modified or replaced to give effect to the underlying intent of the Parties and to the intended economic benefits of the Parties.
    7. The relationship between the Parties shall not be that of partners, agents, or joint ventures for one another, and nothing contained in the Agreement shall be deemed to constitute a partnership or agency agreement between them for any purposes, including federal income tax purposes.  The Parties, in performing any of their obligations hereunder, shall be independent contractors or independent parties and shall discharge their contractual obligations at their own risk.
    8. This Agreement and the rights and obligations under the Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of each Party and their respective successors and permitted assigns.
    9. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument
    10. This Agreement may be duly executed and delivered by a Party by execution and facsimile or electronic, “PDF” delivery of the signature page of a counterpart to the other Party.
    11. If any legal action, arbitration, or other proceeding is brought for the enforcement of the Agreement or because of an alleged dispute, default, misrepresentation, or breach in connection with any of the provisions of the Agreement, except as expressly excluded in the Agreement, the successful or prevailing Party shall be entitled to recover reasonable attorneys’ fees, expenses expert witness fees, and other costs incurred in that action or proceeding in addition to any other relief to which it may be entitled.
    12. If a dispute between the Parties relating this Agreement is not resolved within fifteen (15) days from the date that either Party has notified the other that such dispute exists, then such dispute shall be referred to binding non-administered arbitration in Fairfield County, Connecticut before a single arbitrator under the rules of the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”).  If the Parties cannot agree, within thirty (30) days after the referral of the matter to arbitration, on the person who will act as the arbitrator, then either Party may proceed to file a lawsuit in the Courts of the State of New York as set forth in Section XV, E.
I HAVE READ ALL THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF MY USE OF STUNABLE.COM AND AGREE TO COMPLY WITH ALL PROVISIONS.

• Merchandise must be returned within 21 days of purchase.
• Merchandise must not be worn, altered, or washed.
• Merchandise must have all tags attached.
• Footwear must include the original shoe box in its original condition, without postal labels.
• Shipping and handling charges are not refundable.
• To be eligible for a refund, shoppers must include a valid tracking number for all products being returned.
• Stylists are not responsible for accepting damaged or altered products and are not liable for alterations occurring during transit. It’s recommended that shipping and handling insurance accompany packages containing items that buyers are seeking to return.
• Stylists are responsible for responding directly to buyers within a timely manner and are obligated to process returns and refunds within seven [7] days upon receipt of the returned items.
• Stylists will notify Stunable that a refund is being issued and Stunable will process the transaction by crediting the buyer’s account and notifying the buyer of the refund via email notification.
